glsa.title: GNU C library: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in glibc, the worst of which allowing local attackers to execute arbitrary code as root.

background.p: The GNU C library is the standard C library used by Gentoo Linux systems.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in glibc, amongst others the widely-known recent LD_AUDIT and $ORIGIN issues. For further information please consult the CVE entries referenced below.

impact.p: A local attacker could execute arbitrary code as root, cause a Denial of Service, or gain privileges. Additionally, a user-assisted remote attacker could cause the execution of arbitrary code, and a context-dependent attacker could cause a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
